content.description:
Start in the gully. Climb up and left on a ramp, the ascend the left corner. Â Surmount a "boulder" sandwiched between the lower and upper wall, the move left across it's top to a corner/seam. Ascend the seam then move left into a crack/corner. Top out on the pillar, then clip a bolt on the slab and climb amp and left to chain anchors.

From the ground this route looks like it's going to be a total grovel-fest, but looks are deceiving. It's actually quite good.
content.location: This route starts in the back of the gully.

content.description:
Ascend flakes and short face to a crack system. Protect with cams and small-medium gear. Once at the ledge, traverse left to the anchors.

A fun bolted variation moves left under a micro-roof and onto the face, then climbs to the same anchors.
content.protection: Bolts, a #1 cam protects nicely between bolts 1 and 2
content.location: This route is right of the 90 degree corner/arete formed by the right-hand side of the roof.

content.description: Climb up the slab under the left corner of the roof. Plug a small cam or two into the crack, then work your way up into the pod/corner. Clip a bolt high and right then swing out and onto the outside corner of the roof. Move up perfect patina and diagonal seams to chains at the ledge.
content.protection: A small cam, bolts to chain anchors.
content.location: Left corner of the Tumblebrush Roof

content.description: Climb the slab to the roof, then surmount the roof on crazy awesome holds. Once on the patina face, move left to join "The Good Find".
content.location: This route starts lower down than "The Good Find", right of the corner of the roof.

content.description: Small cams protect the lower part fo the route. Climb the patina face to share anchors with "Knee-Deep in the Tumbleweed"
content.location: Right-most route before the wall turns back into the gully

content.description: Start on top of a perch right of the gully. Clip three bolts on the face then move into the corner, plug in some cams and go for the chains.
content.protection: three bolts then cams to chain anchors
content.location: This is the obvious prow with a crack/dihedral on the upper half of the route.
